intro: Sarcostemma crassifolium, commonly known as the broad-leaved milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its succulent, thick leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. Its leaves are typically broad and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid environments. The flowers are often borne in dense inflorescences and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
